alert.note: Alert for Madison (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 27 at 10:15PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM EDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Big Bend Florida and south central Georgia, including the following counties, in Big Bend Florida, Madison. In south central Georgia, Brooks and Lowndes. * WHEN...Until 115 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1014 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 3 inches of rain have fallen in the last 1 Hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Quitman, Madison, Pavo, Nankin, Empress, Lovett, Blue Springs, Cherry Lake, Hamburg, Brooks Co A/p, Pinetta, Clyattville, Hanson and Dixie. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
